Detailed Description

Printing messages with different importance levels.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum cvl_msg_level_t
 

Importance level of a message.

Enumerator:
CVL_MSG_DBG  Debugging message.
CVL_MSG_INF  Informational message.
CVL_MSG_WRN  Non-critical warning.
CVL_MSG_ERR  Error message.
CVL_MSG_REQ  Requested information.

Function Documentation

void cvl_msg_set_output_level (  cvl_msg_level_t  level  ) 
 

Parameters:
level The level.
Sets minimum importance level for messages.

void cvl_msg_fmt_set_columns (  int  columns  ) 
 

Parameters:
columns The number of columns.
Sets the recommended maximum number of output columns for cvl_msg_fmt(). cvl_msg_fmt() will try to follow this recommendation. If this function is not used or columns is <= 0, then cvl_msg_fmt() will use a default value.

void cvl_msg_set_program_name (  const char *  format,
  ...
) 
 

Parameters:
format The program name.
... Variable argument list.
Sets an optional program name for messages. The program name (if one is set) will appear in front of messages.

void cvl_msg_set_command_name (  const char *  format,
  ...
) 
 

Parameters:
format The command name.
... Variable argument list.
Sets an optional command name for messages. The command name (if one is set) will appear in front of messages, in addition to the program name.

void cvl_msg (  FILE *  f,
cvl_msg_level_t  level,
const char *  format,
  ...
) 
 

Parameters:
f The stream.
level Level of the message.
format The message.
... Variable argument list.
Prints a message to the given stream (usually stderr). The message will only be printed if the level is at least as high as the minimum level that was set before, with cvl_msg_set_output_level(). If the stream f is stderr, the message will be prefixed with the program name and optionally with a command name.

void cvl_msg_dbg (  const char *  format,
  ...
) 
 

Parameters:
format The message.
... Variable argument list.
Shortcut for cvl_msg() with stream stderr and level CVL_MSG_DBG.

  ...

void cvl_msg_fmt (  FILE *  f,
cvl_msg_level_t  level,
const char *  format,
  ...
) 
 

Parameters:
f The stream-
level Level of the text.
format The text.
... Varargs.
Prints a text to the given stream (usually stderr). If the stream f is stderr, the message will be prefixed with the program name and optionally with a command name. Lines will be wrapped so that no line is longer than the amount of characters that was previously set with cvl_msg_fmt_set_columns() (if that is possible). The text may contain its own newline characters; these will be respected. A newline will be appended to the text. The text will only be printed if the level is at least as high as the minimum level that was set before, with cvl_msg_set_output_level().

  ...
